page.title: 11Highwayman's Vineyard
page.content: This vineyard,found at the back of Heath Barn Farm was established in 1974 and is connected with the Fisher family {Lord and Lady Fisher who own Kilverstone Wildlife Park}.At this vineyard English wines are grown and made.They are also bottled on the estate using the latest methods and equipment.The site covers 24 acres,sand over chalk, so it is well drained.The whites are made from Mueller Thurgau and Huxelrebe varieties and the rose from Pinot Noir.The original vineyard site of the ancient Abbey of Bury St Edmunds was incorporated in this present vineyard.
